alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 2:24PM CDT until June 23 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 315 PM CDT. * At 223 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cromwell to near Holdenville to 4 miles north of Stonewall to 5 miles east of Hickory, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained spotter reported 60 mph wind gusts 2 miles northeast of Ada. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ada, Holdenville, Atoka, Coalgate, Wewoka, Wetumka, Byng, Allen, Roff, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Dustin, Lehigh, Tupelo, Francis, Tushka, Calvin, Cromwell, and Fitzhugh. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Atoka; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole
